newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - August 1.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - August 1.

text.p: -- Donna Karan International Inc said Stephen Ruzow had resigned as president and chief operating officer effective immediately. The company also said it expected to report a loss of $0.55 per share or greater for fiscal 1997, excluding potential charges. The stock closed at 14.

-- Oracle Corp Chairman Larry Ellison said in a French newspaper interview he would join Apple Computer Inc's board and present a new management team next week led by Steve Jobs, Apple's co-founder. The New York Times reported that Jobs has been unsuccessfully trying to persuade Eastman Kodak chief executive George Fisher to come to Apple. Apple's stock closed at 17-8/16.

-- Phillips-Van Heusen Corp said it would take a non-recurring pre-tax $55 million charge in the second quarter, reflecting accelerated restructuring activity. The company would cut between 450 and 500 jobs as part of the restructuring. Its stock closed at 14.

-- Federal Express Corp said it had seen a dramatic increase in volume as customers sought to avoid potential shipping disruptions which could arise from a strike at United Parcel Service of America Inc. Fedex stock closed at 64-9/16.
